question: Which of the following airport created a new world record for single-runway operations by handling 980 arrivals and take-offs in 24 hours?
option3: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose International Airport
explanation: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport, Mumbai created a new world record for single-runway operations by handling 980 arrivals and take-offs in 24 hours. As per 2017 annual report of CAPA, the Sydney-based education network, Mumbai airport, which is currently operating at 94% of its maximum passenger handling capacity, will reach saturation point in 2018. Chhatrapati Shivaji International airport, Mumbai which has been facing a sever space crunch, currently handles 45.2 million passengers and on an average, operates around 930 flights per day.
